data.job_description:
Job Description

Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority.

Primary Function of Position:

The React Native Developer is responsible for the hands-on development of mobile applications, focused on hybrid apps, as well as modern native iOS and Android development for smartphones and tablets. This position will report to the sr manager of mobile application development and collaborate with the product, design, human factors, QA, operational teams, cyber security, and other developers. The successful candidate will be deeply hands-on technical, providing front-line engineering support.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Analyzing business requirements and designing, programming, testing, and documenting to support new software and enhance existing software applications
• Performing peer code reviews to ensure quality and keep your skills fresh
• Effectively communicate to team members and partner teams, ensuring delivery timelines, goals, and prioritization are met
• Assisting in the development of coding and technology standards used in the software development of applications
• Implement the latest hybrid and native mobile technology and support the product road map
• Maintain deep technical and business knowledge of industry directions and trends in the area of application architecture and programming languages
• Provide support for operations and support teams, including root cause analysis and preventative analysis
• Responsible for production support, continuous improvement projects, minor enhancement etc.

Responsibilities: The React Native Developer is responsible for the hands-on development of mobile applications, focused on hybrid apps, as well as modern native iOS and Android development for smartphones and tablets
This position will report to the sr manager of mobile application development and collaborate with the product, design, human factors, QA, operational teams, cyber security, and other developers
Analyzing business requirements and designing, programming, testing, and documenting to support new software and enhance existing software applications
Performing peer code reviews to ensure quality and keep your skills fresh
Effectively communicate to team members and partner teams, ensuring delivery timelines, goals, and prioritization are met
Assisting in the development of coding and technology standards used in the software development of applications
Implement the latest hybrid and native mobile technology and support the product road map
Maintain deep technical and business knowledge of industry directions and trends in the area of application architecture and programming languages
Provide support for operations and support teams, including root cause analysis and preventative analysis
Responsible for production support, continuous improvement projects, minor enhancement etc

data.job_description:
Job Description

Job Title: React Frontend Developer
Location: New Jersey, NJ/ Dallas, TX/ Chicago, IL/ Raleigh, NC/ Atlanta, GA (Onsite/ Hybrid)
Employee Type: Full Time with Benefits

Required Skills:
• Hands on experiences with at least 8 years of front end development experience with Mobile First responsive design and implementation of web application using cutting edge technology and frameworks like Next js
• Preferably most recent 2 Yr exp React js Node js RESTful web services HTML5 CSS3 etc
• Solid foundation in data structures algorithms OO Design and patterns
• Experience building large scale distributed systems using RESTful web services
• Comfortable in a fast paced agile process embracing Test Driven Design and APIs leading to CI CD
• Understands ecommerce web applications
• Bachelors in Computer Science Electrical or Computer Engineering or equivalent
• Preferable experience supporting cloud native SaaS deployment and cloud based DevOps

Life at Capgemini

Capgemini supports all aspects of your well-being throughout the changing stages of your life and career. For eligible employees, we offer:
• Flexible work
• Healthcare including dental, vision, mental health, and well-being programs
• Financial well-being programs such as 401(k) and Employee Share Ownership Plan
• Paid time off and paid holidays
• Paid parental leave
• Family building benefits like adoption assistance, surrogacy, and cryopreservation
• Social well-being benefits like subsidized back-up child/elder care and tutoring
• Mentoring, coaching and learning programs
• Employee Resource Groups
• Disaster Relief

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 360,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2022 global revenues of €22 billion.
Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

Disclaimer

Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.

This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.

Capgemini is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or accommodation, please reach out to your recruiting contact.

Click the following link for more information on your rights as an Applicant http://www.capgemini.com/resources/equal-employment-opportunity-is-the-law

Qualifications: Hands on experiences with at least 8 years of front end development experience with Mobile First responsive design and implementation of web application using cutting edge technology and frameworks like Next js
Preferably most recent 2 Yr exp React js Node js RESTful web services HTML5 CSS3 etc
Solid foundation in data structures algorithms OO Design and patterns
Experience building large scale distributed systems using RESTful web services
Comfortable in a fast paced agile process embracing Test Driven Design and APIs leading to CI CD
Understands ecommerce web applications
Bachelors in Computer Science Electrical or Computer Engineering or equivalent
Preferable experience supporting cloud native SaaS deployment and cloud based DevOps

data.job_description: As a React Node Full Stack Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining innovative web applications that deliver exceptional user experiences. Your expertise in both front-end and back-end technologies will be essential in creating responsive, high-performance, and scalable applications. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and other developers to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Your work will contribute to the success of our company by ensuring the technical excellence of our products.

Responsibilities: As a React Node Full Stack Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining innovative web applications that deliver exceptional user experiences
Your expertise in both front-end and back-end technologies will be essential in creating responsive, high-performance, and scalable applications
You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and other developers to deliver cutting-edge solutions
Your work will contribute to the success of our company by ensuring the technical excellence of our products

more

Find similar career opportunities

React Native Front-End Developer Category: Software Development/ Engineering
Main location: United States, Florida, Jacksonville
Position ID: J0823-0416
Employment Type: Full Time
Meet our professionals

U.S. - Work with purpose

Position Description:

CGI is seeking a React Native Front End Developer with expertise in integrating mobile applications with Salesforce.

Your future duties and responsibilities:

1. Mobile UI/UX Development: Design and develop intuitive, responsive, and visually appealing user interfaces for our React Native mobile application, adhering to best practices and user experience guidelines.
2. Salesforce API Integration: Collaborate with backend developers and Salesforce administrators to integrate the mobile application with Salesforce using REST APIs, ensuring smooth data synchronization and real-time updates.
3. Data Management: Manage data flow between the mobile application and Salesforce, implementing mechanisms for data validation, synchronization, and error handling to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
4. Performance Optimization: Identify performance bottlenecks in the application and optimize code, API calls, and data caching to deliver a smooth and responsive user experience.
5. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, designers, and backend developers to translate requirements into technical specifications and deliver high-quality solutions.
6. Unit Testing: Write unit tests for the React Native components and functionality, ensuring code reliability and maintainability.
7. Documentation: Document the codebase, API integrations, and technical decisions to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding for other team members.
8. Troubleshooting and Bug Fixing: Investigate and resolve issues related to the mobile application's UI, functionality, and Salesforce integration, collaborating with cross-functional teams as necessary.
Continuous Learning: Stay up to date with the latest trends, tools, and best practices in React Native development, Salesforce integration, and mobile application development in general.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

Proven experience developing mobile applications using React Native, with a strong portfolio of relevant projects.
Proficiency in JavaScript, ES6+, and React Native libraries and tools
Familiarity with Salesforce's data model, REST APIs, and security mechanisms
Strong written and oral communication skills. Able to document codebase, API integrations, and facilitate knowledge transfer.

Desired Qualifications/Non-Essential Skills
-Ability to facilitate a flexible and efficiency work model across the flows, client stakeholders, and team members.
-Technical Leadership
-Presentation, Demo, and Visual Story Boards
-Able to flex hours to meet time zone needs of the client and other teammates as necessary
-Able to travel occasionally
-Technical certifications to align with front end development. Salesforce certifications a plus.

CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is $67,200 - $146,900.

At CGI we call our professionals "members" to reinforce that all who join our team are, as owners, empowered to participate in the challenges and rewards that come from building a world-class company. CGI's benefits include:
Competitive base salaries
Eligibility to participate in an attractive Share Purchase Plan (SPP) in which the company matches dollar-for-dollar contributions made by eligible employees, up to a maximum, for their job category
401(k) Plan and Profit Participation for eligible members
Generous holidays, vacation, and sick leave plans
Comprehensive insurance plans that include, among other benefits, medical, dental, vision, life, disability, out-of-county emergency coverage in all countries of employment;
Back-up child care, Pet insurance, a Member Assistance Program, a 529 college savings program, a personal financial management tool, lifestyle management programs and more

#LI-BR1

Skills:
• Front End Development
• Leadership

What you can expect from us:

Insights you can act on

While technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.

CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.

We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members.

All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held. CGI will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local regulations and ordinances.

CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.

data.job_description:
Summit Human Capital is seeking a highly driven 100% REMOTE Front-End React Developer to work with a fast-growing renewable energy company startup! You will have the opportunity to play a crucial role in developing and maintaining a Virtual Power Plant management platform. If you have a passion for front-end development, consider this opportunity! The ideal candidate will meet the following criteria:

Must Have skills:
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or any other related field
• Strong frontend development skills using React.js
• Expertise using JavaScript or TypeScript
• Capability to create RESTful APIS
• Operating knowledge of AWS
Desired skills:
• Proficiency with energy management systems
• Experience with Fullstack applications (Python, FastAPI)
• Current knowledge of cybersecurity principles and appropriate practices
Responsibilities:
• Create responsive web applications using React.js
• Collaborate with product team members to create to implement visually appealing user interfaces
• Write clean and well-documented code that meets industry standards and participate in code reviews
• Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
• Collaborate with backend developers to implement frontend project components
• Continue to educate yourself with latest frontend trends, appropriate practices and technologies

Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or any other related field
Strong frontend development skills using React.js
Expertise using JavaScript or TypeScript
Capability to create RESTful APIS
Operating knowledge of AWS

Continue to educate yourself with latest frontend trends, appropriate practices and technologies

data.job_description:
Job Description: Front-End Web Developer
Location: Irving, TX (Hybrid role)

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Front-End Web Developer with a minimum of 9 years of experience to join our dynamic development team. The ideal candidate will have a strong design background, extensive hands-on experience with React JS, and a proven track record of implementing front-end solutions within a scalable production environment.

Key Responsibilities:
• Leverage your comprehensive 9 years of front-end web development experience to deliver high-quality and visually appealing user interfaces.
• Utilize your strong design knowledge to create captivating and user-centric designs.
• Implement and optimize web applications using React JS and Redux, while ensuring performance and scalability.
• Apply your proficiency in JavaScript to create efficient and functional web applications.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to consume REST APIs and ensure seamless integration.
• Utilize your expertise in HTML5, CSS3, SASS or LESS, and frameworks like Bootstrap, Foundation, or Materialize to craft responsive and engaging user interfaces.
• Leverage tools such as Redux, Webpack, Angular CLI, and Gulp to enhance development efficiency and maintainability.
• Demonstrate your understanding of client-side architecture and design patterns to create well-structured and maintainable code.
• Be well-versed in the Agile Software Development Life Cycle and have experience in Scrum-driven projects.
• Address cross-browser compatibility issues and implement performance optimizations for optimal user experience.
• Collaborate with version control tools like Git to ensure effective code management and collaboration.
• Showcase your exceptional problem-solving skills to overcome technical challenges and provide innovative solutions.
• Work independently to take ownership of projects and deliver results within specified timelines.

Qualifications and Requirements:
• Minimum of 9 years of front-end web development experience.
• Strong proficiency in React JS, with hands-on implementation experience.
• Experience with Redux and NgRX.
• Solid programming experience in HTML5, CSS3, SASS or LESS.
• Familiarity with front-end frameworks like Bootstrap, Foundation, or Materialize.
• Proficiency in JavaScript and its libraries.
• Experience with tools such as Redux, Webpack, Angular CLI, and Gulp.
• Proven ability to consume REST APIs and integrate them into web applications.
• Understanding of client-side architecture and design patterns.
• Exposure to the Agile Software Development Life Cycle and Scrum methodologies.
• Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and performance considerations.
• Strong version control skills using Git.
• Exceptional problem-solving capabilities.
• Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
• Solid communication and interpersonal skills.
• If you are a highly motivated Front-End Web Developer with a proven track record in React JS and a passion for creating exceptional user experiences, we invite you to apply. Join our dynamic team and contribute to the development of cutting-edge web applications in an agile and collaborative environment.

To Apply:
Please submit your updated resume along with a portfolio showcasing your relevant front-end development work.

Life at Capgemini
Capgemini supports all aspects of your well-being throughout the changing stages of your life and career. For eligible employees, we offer:
• Flexible work
• Healthcare including dental, vision, mental health, and well-being programs
• Financial well-being programs such as 401(k) and Employee Share Ownership Plan
• Paid time off and paid holidays
• Paid parental leave
• Family building benefits like adoption assistance, surrogacy, and cryopreservation
• Social well-being benefits like subsidized back-up child/elder care and tutoring
• Mentoring, coaching and learning programs
• Employee Resource Groups
• Disaster Relief

About Capgemini
Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 360,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2022 global revenues of €22 billion.
Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, genetics, veteran status, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.

This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.

Capgemini is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or accommodation, please reach out to your recruiting contact.

data.job_description:
Piper Companies is seeking a JavaScript Developer – React/Node for a leading technology firm in the Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina area. The JavaScript Developer – React/Node will be joining a growing software development team participating in greenfield development. An ideal candidate for the JavaScript Developer – React/Node is passionate about learning new technologies to leverage in new development projects.

Responsibilities for the JavaScript Developer – React/Node include:
• Design, develop, and implement JavaScript solutions leveraging React
• Work closely with the architecture team for the design and review of development projects to ensure the work is in line with the overall design and strategy
• Participate in an Agile team and be actively involved in the full software development life cycle
• Develop new and improve existing processes
• Create and perform unit tests and test automation

Requirements for the JavaScript Developer – React/Node include:
• Over 3 years of professional software engineering experience building cloud native applications
• Proficiency with React and Node
• Strong full stack experience including creating and consuming RESTful APIs
• AWS experience
• Previous experience writing unit tests
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering and/or relevant work experience

Compensation of the JavaScript Developer – React/Node includes:
• $105,000 - $145,000 annually with a full comprehensive benefits
• No relocation assistance, sponsorship, or C2C arrangements available

Keywords: Full Stack Developer, Web Application Developer, Software Developer, Software Engineer, Morrisville, Durham, Research Triangle Park, Cary, RTP, Raleigh, Apex, Wake Forest, North Carolina, NC.

Over 3 years of professional software engineering experience building cloud native applications
Proficiency with React and Node
Strong full stack experience including creating and consuming RESTful APIs
AWS experience
Previous experience writing unit tests
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering and/or relevant work experience

Work closely with the architecture team for the design and review of development projects to ensure the work is in line with the overall design and strategy

data.job_description:
Description

Bakkt is looking for a skilled React engineer who is excited to explore blockchain related systems across our application stack. Your role as a Senior React Engineer is to guide a team of engineers in the design, development, testing, and deployment of large-scale front-end applications for our blockchain custody & market-making systems.

What You Will Do
• Be a leading voice of best practices in Javascript, Typescript, & React frameworks
• Work cross functionally with our product, project, development, and ops teams
• Improve the testability, quality, & automation of our applications
• Key contributor to the overall client application architecture and direction of Bakkt Applications
• Plan and decompose high-level features, providing accurate estimates and roadmap/development plans
• Analyze the development processes and procedures to determine areas for improvement
• Coach, mentor, and motivate software engineers in a high-performance software development organization

What We Are Looking For
• Strong in Javascript/Node
• Passionate about Typescript
• Well versed in React, React Router, familiar with Loader patterns
• Excellent debugging skills
• A passion for well tested, fully functioning & scalable applications
• Self-motivated, well organized, and an excellent communicator - both written and verbal
• Able to unblock yourself in a largely asynchronous work environment
• Enjoy helping others and helping to raise the skill level of others
• Passionate about crypto and bridging the gap from traditional finance to blockchain!

Requirements
• 8+ years of deep, hands-on experience, building Typescript based React Applications
• Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
• Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
• Experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux)
• Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools
• Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
• Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
• A knack for benchmarking and optimization

Why You Will Love Bakkt!

Flexible work experience with the option to be fully remote, or work in one of our two office locations in Atlanta or New York.

Inclusive work environment. We believe in diversity and inclusiveness. There is room and acceptance for you here at Bakkt!

Incredible career opportunity in one of the most exciting and booming industries in the world!

Bakkt is devoted to having diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Bakkt does not make any employment decisions based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity of any other characteristic protected by law. Must successfully pass a post-offer background check and drug screen.

Qualifications: Strong in Javascript/Node
Passionate about Typescript
Well versed in React, React Router, familiar with Loader patterns
Excellent debugging skills
A passion for well tested, fully functioning & scalable applications
Self-motivated, well organized, and an excellent communicator - both written and verbal
Able to unblock yourself in a largely asynchronous work environment
8+ years of deep, hands-on experience, building Typescript based React Applications
Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model
Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
Experience with popular React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux)
Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools
Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
A knack for benchmarking and optimization
Must successfully pass a post-offer background check and drug screen
Responsibilities: Your role as a Senior React Engineer is to guide a team of engineers in the design, development, testing, and deployment of large-scale front-end applications for our blockchain custody & market-making systems
Be a leading voice of best practices in Javascript, Typescript, & React frameworks
Work cross functionally with our product, project, development, and ops teams
Improve the testability, quality, & automation of our applications
Key contributor to the overall client application architecture and direction of Bakkt Applications
Plan and decompose high-level features, providing accurate estimates and roadmap/development plans
Analyze the development processes and procedures to determine areas for improvement
Coach, mentor, and motivate software engineers in a high-performance software development organization

data.job_description:
Our client, a leader and innovator in their industry, needs a Senior UX Developer to support front end application development for prioritized applications. You will work with Agile teams to prototype, test, and deliver application front end as designed and on schedule. This role is 100% remote within the United States.

Due to client requirement, applicants must be willing and able to work on a w2 basis. For our w2 consultants, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits, 401k with company matching, and life insurance.

Responsibilities of the Senior UX Developer:
• Develop UI components for complex websites and applications
• Work closely with UX designers, web developers, and other team members
• Convert mockups into cross-browser HTML/CSS/JavaScript web components
• Perform unit testing and document new features developed
• Monitor trends in UI development and adhere to technology standards and best practices
• Support an evolving design system and component library
Requirements of the Senior UX Developer:
• 6+ years of experience creating and implementing UI development, ideally in a large enterprise environment
• Extensive coding, React/TypeScript, and the ability to troubleshoot and analyze websites using HTML, CSS
• Continued education and research into UI development trends and current design strategy and technology
• Advanced problem-solving skills and the ability to optimize code for the best possible outcome
• Ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment to create top-performing interfaces
• Proficient with visual design programs such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD
• Knowledge of web component technologies like: Stencil.js, Polymer

Please be advised- If anyone reaches out to you about an open position connected with Eliassen Group, please confirm that they have an Eliassen.com email address and never provide personal or financial information to anyone who is not clearly associated with Eliassen Group. If you have any indication of fraudulent activity, please contact

.

Job ID: 379114

About Eliassen Group:

Eliassen Group is a leading strategic consulting company that provides business and IT services for our clients as they seek to transform and execute strategies that will drive exceptional outcomes. Leveraging over 30 years of success, we focus on professional services, talent solutions, and life sciences. Eliassen Group offers local community presence and deep networks. We are committed to positively impacting the lives of our employees, clients, consultants, and the communities in which we operate.

Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Don't miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check!

6+ years of experience creating and implementing UI development, ideally in a large enterprise environment

Ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment to create top-performing interfaces
Proficient with visual design programs such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD
Knowledge of web component technologies like: Stencil.js, Polymer
Responsibilities: You will work with Agile teams to prototype, test, and deliver application front end as designed and on schedule
Develop UI components for complex websites and applications
Work closely with UX designers, web developers, and other team members
Convert mockups into cross-browser HTML/CSS/JavaScript web components
